comment: This was by far the easiest Econ class I've ever taken I would 100% recommend taking this Econ class, especially during the summertime, I wish I had taken him sooner. The guides are very helpful and mostly everything on the study guide is on the test and or quizzes and the textbook is also very helpful and lectures as well. 10/10 professor
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The only assignments are weekly quizzes, extra credit, and the final exam. You didn't have to go to class, but he made the lectures very engaging, and interesting to where you wouldn't really want to miss class. Hopefully he's able to become a full-time professor!
out of my whole freshman year Slade Dale has been the best professor I've had. he is very caring, understand and he gives the best lectures you can imagine.

open note quiz every week with no lockdown or webcam, 5 exams in person with lockdown and you can do test corrections to get 1/2 the points back for missed questions, attendance not mandatory but extra credit points some classes, I had to take an exam a different date and he was very flexibly with when I took it! very nice guy would recommend

Take Slade for Econ! Exams are in class on your computer, but you can do exam corrections after. Final is optional. Extra credit available only if you show up to class. He is very engaging with his lectures! A little slow with grading but he gets it in eventually.

Very outgoing, funny, and friendly. Definitely has a strong passion for Economics and his lectures are always energetic & engaging. He posts his slides on d2l & gives 3 in person extra credit sessions where you just show up, we do an activity & it's 3 extra points to your grade. Weekly online open note quizzes + final in person. Def a free A class.

TAKE THIS CLASS his test are in person but its online so after every test (5 test) you can redo the questions you get wrong for half a point which is a life savior. His quizzes aren't hard and 2 lowest grades are dropped. The final is easy what ever you get on it you will automatically receive half the points back for wrong answer.

Extremely easy if you need the credit. 99 in the class right now and there are 5 extra credit opportunities (4 in person). Quizzes are open with no lockdown browser. He's fun with his lectures and open for questions. Very nice and open to talk.

Very funny and friendly, and makes his lectures very engaging and easy to follow. Just a few light assignments, accompanied by easy weekly quizzes, based on his detailed PowerPoints. Easily digestible course.
Nice & funny professor, easy A for sure. Would take again if I needed to take another econ class.
Final is a big portion of your grade but all quizzes online and no homework

The best instructor I've had the pleasure to learn under in my entire academic career. He has a way of making even the most boring and mind numbing concepts engaging and interesting, dude's a 10/10 communicator.
I took him over the summer and it was a free A for the most part

I took him in the Summer of 2024, there were 21 quizzes, 3 exams, and 1 final exam (lowest quiz and exam gets dropped). He gives out 2 extra credit opportunities. The exam and quizzes were no lock down, and there was no webcam. He was easy and responded quickly to emails. Yes, there are a lot of quizzes but it is super easy just use your resources!
Lectures were engaging, very kind and you only have to show up 3 times to class to get extra credit. No homework and open note quiz each week. Final exam was an exact copy of all the quizzes.
He's great! In depth lectures, passionate about econ. Great prof especially if you're taking his course as a gen-ed.
Not a professor yet but should be. Great lectures, goes very in depth, and honestly just cares passionately about his job and students.
